itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer (1900-1968)

wikipedia_page.main: David "Dai" Lewis Jones (26 March 1900 – 16 December 1968) was a Welsh rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for Wales, and at club level for Ebbw Vale RFC, Risca RFC and Newport RFC, as a prop, i.e. number 1 or 3, and club level rugby league (RL) for Wigan (Heritage № 326) and Leigh  (Heritage № 363), as a prop, second-row or loose forward, i.e. number 8 or 10, 11 or 12, or 13, during the era of contested scrums.
